channel.title: Unclickable Images : DIV

item.title: Unclickable Images : DIV
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“CStrife, post:5, topic:538084”]That is the worst Html i have seen by far… L2 code html & css correctly…

This Trash…

<div id="top">
<div id="logo">
<nav class="clearfix">  
    <ul class="clearfix">  
</div>
<div id="home">
<a href="">Home</a><a href="">Profile</a>
</div>
<div id="jii">
<a href="#"><img src="Home_icon_black.png" width="30"></a>
</div>
</nav>  
</ul>

Should be like this…

<div id="top">
        <div id="logo">
            <nav class="clearfix">  
                <ul class="clearfix">  
                    <div id="home">
                        <a href="#">Home</a><a href="">Profile</a>
                    </div>
                    <div id="jii">
                        <a href="#"><img src="Home_icon_black.png" width="30"></a>
                    </div>
                </ul>
            </nav> 
        </div>
    </div>

That won’t fix the error though…
But start by learning how CSS works, and you might understand why you get the error…
Second… FUCK POSITION it’s a bullshit CSS Rule that is unessecarily abused 98% of the time…[/quote]

I’m just wondering why this guy is condoning the use of the

tag in place of an
  • tag within a list… Lol.

    • Read full topic

item.title: Unclickable Images : DIV
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Honestly I can’t tell if the guy above me is trolling or not. If you seriously think that the position property is bullshit then you have a lot to learn, take a look at this article. You mustn’t understand fully the uses of position if you think it’s “unnecessarily abused”.

item.title: Unclickable Images : DIV
item.dc:creator: @CStrife CStrife
item.description:
@CStrife wrote:

That is the worst Html i have seen by far… L2 code html & css correctly…

This Trash…

<div id="top">
<div id="logo">
<nav class="clearfix">  
    <ul class="clearfix">  
</div>
<div id="home">
<a href="">Home</a><a href="">Profile</a>
</div>
<div id="jii">
<a href="#"><img src="Home_icon_black.png" width="30"></a>
</div>
</nav>  
</ul>

Should be like this…

<div id="top">
        <div id="logo">
            <nav class="clearfix">  
                <ul class="clearfix">  
                    <div id="home">
                        <a href="#">Home</a><a href="">Profile</a>
                    </div>
                    <div id="jii">
                        <a href="#"><img src="Home_icon_black.png" width="30"></a>
                    </div>
                </ul>
            </nav> 
        </div>
    </div>

That won’t fix the error though…
But start by learning how CSS works, and you might understand why you get the error…
Second… FUCK POSITION it’s a bullshit CSS Rule that is unessecarily abused 98% of the time…

Read full topic

item.title: Unclickable Images : DIV
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Let me outline somethings you’ve done wrong here.

<div id="top">
<div id="logo">
<nav class="clearfix">  
    <ul class="clearfix">  
</div>
<div id="home">
<a href="">Home</a><a href="">Profile</a>
</div>
<div id="jii">
<a href="#"><img src="Home_icon_black.png" width="30"></a>
</div>
</nav>  
</ul>
</div>
<div id="left">
</div>
<div id="right">
</div>
<div id="center">
<br>
<div id="imgs">
</div>
</div>
<div id="bottom">
</div>
<body>
<div id='container'>
  <ol class="row" id="updates">
                <a href="<?php echo $username; ?>">
                <div id="lel">
<div id="marg">
    <img src="images/<?php  echo $filename; ?>" width="135px" height="135px"/>
        </div>
        </div>
        </a>
    <?php  } ?>
  </ol>
      <a id="<?php  echo $image_id; ?>" href="#" class="load_more" >
  <div class="css_style" id="css_style">
  <div id="text">
  Load more...
  </div>
</div>
  • Body tag in the middle of the document…
  • Clear fixes on elements that are empty…
  • Un-closed/extra tags…
  • Crazy CSS

The problem could be one of many things. I’m not going to spoon feed you here but by just reading it I have found a few factors that may be making the horrendous disaster not work.

padding: 68px 250px 50px 500px;
height: 1000px;

Read full topic

item.title: Unclickable Images : DIV
item.dc:creator: @Frantix Frantix
item.description:
@Frantix wrote:

More then half of my webpage isn’t clickable so there are images and I made them clickable but when I hover over them they aren’t clickable except for the last 2 it’s like there is an invisible block covering them and the header. It’s they entire left side I cannot figure it out, here’s the divs and css

[code=html4strict]

HomeProfile

    <?php } ?>
Load more...
[/code] [code=css]#center { width: 844px; height: 539px; float: left; position: absolute; margin: 0; } #top { background-image: url(download.png); height: 33px; width:100%; float:left; } #left { width: 200px; height: 1000px; float: left; border-right: #e9e9e9 1px solid; margin: 0; } #right { width: 200px; height: 1000px; float: right; border-left: #e9e9e9 1px solid; margin: 0; } #logo { float:left; margin-left: 40px; } #home { margin-top: 8px; float: right; margin-right: 120px; } #jii { float: right; margin-right: 250px; } #imgs2 { float: right; padding: 68px 250px 50px 500px; position: absolute; } #imgs { float: right; padding: 50px 250px 50px 300px; position: absolute; } nav { background-image: url(download.png); height: 33px; width: 100%; position: relative; font-family:"lucida grande",tahoma,verdana,arial,sans-serif; font-size:11px; } nav ul { padding: 0; margin: 0 auto; width: 600px; height: 33px; } nav li { display: inline; float: left; } #marg { float: right; margin-top: 70px; margin-right: 23px; } #lel { margin-right: 270px; } [/code]
